author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BERYL STILL FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE AGAIN BEFORE LANDFALL IN TEXAS... ...ADDITIONAL HURRICANE WARNINGS ISSUED FURTHER UP THE TEXAS COAST...
summary:
...BERYL STILL FORECAST TO BECOME A HURRICANE AGAIN BEFORE LANDFALL IN TEXAS... ...ADDITIONAL HURRICANE WARNINGS ISSUED FURTHER UP THE TEXAS COAST...
 As of 4:00 AM CDT Sun Jul 7
 the center of Beryl was located near 25.3, -94.6
 with movement NW at 12 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 995 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 60 mph.
